result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Steven Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: 21CM2269 but concurrent to count 2; with credit for 30 days served; Huber privileges for work and treatment
Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00pm on 06-22-2022

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample during term of probation. DV assessment imposed; as to count 2. Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA and DV surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
- Restitution set at zero.
Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition

- NO CORPORAL PUNISMENT on any child.
- NO CONTACT with victim which rises to the level of judicial probable cause.
- NO CONTACT with firearms.

- Complete Batterers Intervention Program or a course in Anger Management.
- Complete Parenting Classes.
- Mental Health Evaluation; take all prescribed medications.

- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt: See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific month due dates for this ATYPP.
Affidavit and order for payment of attorney fees and costs due from Milwaukee County signed.  Filed by:  CHRISTIAN THOMAS  $1,080.00
of attorney fees and costs due from Milwaukee County, signed and filed.

Defendant Anthony S Martinez in court with attorney Christian Thomas.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to 21CM1800 but concurrent to count 2, with credit for 30 days served.  Huber privileges for work and treatment.

AS TO COUNT 2: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to 21CM1800 but concurrent to count 1, with credit for 30 days served.  Huber privileges for work and treatment.

Court STAYED the sentences and placed the defendant on probation for 18 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Complete batterer's intervention program or a course in anger management.
- Complete Parenting Classes.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- No corporal punishment on any child.
- No contact with victim which rises to the level of judicial probable cause.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.
- DV assessment imposed, as to count 2.
- Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA and DV surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay. Any cash bail on deposit to apply and the remaining balance to be returned to the poster.

- Court set restitution at zero.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
*Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 6/22/22.

Received and filed: Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.
Pretrial Services Status Report 5-31-22, filed.  rmm
Court SETS a $3,000.00 signature bond. ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing. All previously ordered conditions of bail to remain the same.

Defendant Anthony Steven Martinez in court with attorney Christian Thomas.  Defendant Anthony Steven Martinez in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea hearing held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Court held colloquy with the defendant regarding his right to have an in-person hearing. State has filed an AMENDED information. Defense counsel acknowledges receipt, waives reading, and enters a temporary not guilty plea.  Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Counts 3 AND 4 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2: Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court vacates the bail/bond hearing. Case adjourned to Branch 29 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.

for expedited plea, filed and forwarded to the Judge for review.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 29:
Defendant Anthony Steven Martinez in court by video with Attorney Christian Thomas who appears in person.  Defendant Anthony Steven Martinez in custody.  Mallory Davis appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.  
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Defense requests to be heard on bail on the next date. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 29.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Steven Martinez not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Attorney Christian Thomas to be appointed by Judge Kiefer. Matter remains calendared for a preliminary hearing 4/21/2022 at 8:30am in CJF Rm 146.
signed and filed.

Defendant Anthony Steven Martinez in court, in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a bail/bond and preliminary hearing.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Christian Thomas to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with V.N.M (DOB 12/17/76) ; N.J.M (DOB 8/7/07) and A.M (DOB 2/7/02)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Anthony Steven Martinez in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Defendant Anthony Steven Martinez in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Anthony Steven Martinez appeared by video means with Attorney. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Court enter pleas of not guilty to count 2. Court reserves defendant rights of substitution. DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
